intro: Eriocaulon nairii, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Eriocaulaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and dense clusters of small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland or aquatic environments, thriving in marshy areas and along the edges of ponds. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, dry fruits known as caryopses. Eriocaulon nairii is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, contributing to the biodiversity of wetland ecosystems.
